Description: Two, poorly preserved faience fragments of a small pendant, joining. Object card shows it was a plaque, flat on the rear, with a relief of a seated Heh god at the front, holding two rnpt-branches that form the lateral sides of the amulet. Above and underneath the plaque each a horizontal perforation, now broken off. Only white paste preserved.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report
